newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to integrate Infospace directory.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to integrate Infospace directory.

text.p: InfoSpace Inc Tuesday said that Microsoft Corp will integrate access to InfoSpace's directories into Microsoft's Internet Explorer 3.0 web browser.
Terms of the agreement were not disclosed.
InfoSpace's Internet directories allow users to locate people, land addresses, telephone and fax numbers and e-mail addresses on the Internet.
"Our relationship with InfoSpace will give users of Microsoft Internet Mail and News an easy, accurate way to locate anyone on the Internet," said Yusuf Mehdi, a group product manager at Microsoft.
Microsoft Internet Mail and News for Windows 95 and Windows NT operating systems are part of the Explorer web browser.
InfoSpace is a private company founded by Naveen Jain, a former group manager for Microsoft's MSN online network.
